FAQ

What is the Pomodoro Technique?

The Pomodoro Technique is a time management method that uses a timer to break work into intervals, typically 25 minutes, separated by short breaks. After 4 work sessions, take a longer break.

How does it work?

Work for the set duration (default 25 minutes), then take a short break (default 5 minutes). After 4 work sessions, take a long break (default 15 minutes).

Can I customize the durations?

Yes, you can adjust the work duration, short break, and long break times using the options above.
